executiveSummary: A configurable, extensible adaptive testing engine supporting multiple exam methodologies (CAT, LOFT, Linear) with AI-augmented content authoring and smart analytics. The platform treats exam rules, stopping criteria, and scoring algorithms as configurable metadata rather than hard-coded logic.
problemStatement: Current adaptive testing platforms are typically hard-coded for specific exam types (e.g., NCLEX, GMAT), making it costly and time-consuming to adapt them for new domains or methodologies. Organizations need a flexible, extensible platform that can support multiple exam types, scoring models, and content domains without requiring core engine modifications.
targetUsers: Test Administrators - Configure exam profiles, manage question banks, and monitor test delivery
Content Authors - Create, review, and manage question content across multiple domains
Test Takers - Students and professionals taking adaptive exams for certification or assessment
Psychometricians - Analyze test performance, calibrate items, and validate scoring models
System Integrators - Integrate the platform with external LMS and credential systems
objectives: Enable support for multiple exam methodologies (CAT, LOFT, Linear, Section-Adaptive) through a single configurable engine
Reduce time-to-market for new exam types by 80% through pluggable strategy architecture
Achieve sub-200ms next-item latency for optimal test-taker experience
Provide AI-augmented content authoring to accelerate question bank development
Deliver actionable analytics through Smart Coach to improve learner outcomes
Launch B2C platform with subscription and purchase options for individual students
Provide seamless cross-device experience via web and mobile applications
inScope: Polymorphic exam engine with configurable algorithms and stopping rules
Universal question bank supporting multiple item types and domains
AI-augmented content authoring with human-in-the-loop validation
Smart Coach analytics including gap analysis and adaptive remediation
Session state management with resume capability
Item exposure control and anti-harvesting protection
Audit logging and ACID-compliant data storage
Student Progress Dashboard with post-exam analytics and performance insights
Topic-based learning path with targeted practice exams
Intelligent exam scheduling based on study time and topic coverage
Admin Dashboard for question bank and content management
B2C Platform with exam catalog for individual students
Student subscription plans and one-time exam purchases
Mobile app support (iOS and Android) with progress sync
outOfScope: Proctoring and identity verification services (third-party integration only)
Integration with specific LMS platforms (API-first approach for future integrations)
Psychometric research and item calibration studies (platform supports data export)
constraints: Must comply with accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA)
Must support PostgreSQL as the primary database for ACID compliance
Scoring Service must be implemented in Python for statistical library support
Must operate in cloud-agnostic containerized environment (Docker/Kubernetes)
API response times must meet P95 < 200ms SLA for adaptive item selection

requirements.title: Polymorphic Exam Engine
requirements.description: The system must support a 'Pluggable Strategy' architecture to handle different exam methodologies dynamically.
requirements.rationale: A pluggable architecture enables rapid deployment of new exam types without modifying core engine code.

requirements.title: Session State Management
requirements.description: The system must preserve the state of every active exam session with resume capability.
requirements.rationale: Session persistence is critical for high-stakes testing.

requirements.title: Navigation Control
requirements.description: The system must support configurable navigation constraints.
requirements.rationale: Different exam methodologies require different navigation rules.

requirements.title: Dynamic Item Schema
requirements.description: The database must use JSONB structures to store question content.
requirements.rationale: Schema-agnostic storage enables support for any domain.

requirements.title: Hierarchical Tagging
requirements.description: Questions must support a flexible tagging tree.
requirements.rationale: Flexible tagging enables content reuse.

requirements.title: Psychometric Metadata
requirements.description: Every question record must store psychometric parameters.
requirements.rationale: Psychometric metadata is essential for IRT-based adaptive algorithms.

requirements.title: AI Generation Pipeline
requirements.description: The system shall provide an interface to prompt an LLM to generate draft items.
requirements.rationale: AI-augmented authoring accelerates question bank development.

requirements.title: Human-in-the-Loop Validation
requirements.description: Generated items must enter a DRAFT state with workflow approval.
requirements.rationale: Human validation ensures content quality.

requirements.title: Gap Analysis
requirements.description: The system must compare user's Current Theta against Target Theta.
requirements.rationale: Gap analysis helps learners understand their readiness.

requirements.title: Velocity Prediction
requirements.description: The system shall calculate a Ready Date based on improvement rate.
requirements.rationale: Velocity prediction helps learners plan their study schedule.

requirements.title: Adaptive Remediation
requirements.description: The system must generate dynamic study tasks targeting weak areas.
requirements.rationale: Targeted remediation improves learning efficiency.

requirements.title: Strategy Pattern Implementation
requirements.description: The backend code must use the Strategy Design Pattern for the scoring engine.
requirements.rationale: Strategy pattern ensures extensibility.

requirements.title: Service Decoupling
requirements.description: The Scoring Service must be completely decoupled from the Content Service.
requirements.rationale: Service decoupling enables independent scaling.

requirements.title: Next-Item Latency
requirements.description: Next adaptive question must render in less than 200ms (P95).
requirements.rationale: Low latency is critical for test-taker experience.

requirements.title: Horizontal Scaling
requirements.description: The system must support horizontal scaling for 10,000 concurrent sessions.
requirements.rationale: Horizontal scaling ensures availability during peak periods.

requirements.title: Item Exposure Control
requirements.description: The item selection algorithm must include exposure control method.
requirements.rationale: Exposure control prevents item compromise.

requirements.title: Anti-Harvesting Protection
requirements.description: The API must implement rate limiting and anomaly detection.
requirements.rationale: Anti-harvesting protection preserves question bank integrity.

requirements.title: Audit Logging
requirements.description: All test-taker actions must be logged for forensic analysis.
requirements.rationale: Comprehensive audit logging supports fraud investigation.

requirements.title: ACID Compliance
requirements.description: Exam results must be stored with strict transaction guarantees.
requirements.rationale: ACID compliance ensures no exam results are lost.

requirements.title: Student Progress Dashboard
requirements.description: The system must provide a comprehensive student dashboard displaying progress analytics, performance trends, topic-wise proficiency, and historical exam results with visual charts and graphs.
requirements.rationale: Students need visibility into their progress to stay motivated and make informed study decisions.

requirements.title: Post-Exam Performance Analytics
requirements.description: After every exam completion, the system must display detailed analytics including: overall score, topic-wise performance breakdown, time spent per question, improvement areas, comparison with previous attempts, and specific topics requiring more study time.
requirements.rationale: Immediate feedback after exams helps students understand their strengths and weaknesses while the experience is fresh.

requirements.title: Study Time Recommendations
requirements.description: The system must calculate and display recommended study time per topic based on performance gaps, providing specific hour estimates and prioritized topic lists to help students allocate their preparation time effectively.
requirements.rationale: Personalized study time recommendations improve learning efficiency by focusing effort on weak areas.

requirements.title: Topic-Based Practice Exams
requirements.description: The system must support creation and delivery of topic-specific practice exams that target individual weak areas, allowing students to take focused assessments on specific topics or categories before attempting the full exam.
requirements.rationale: Topic-focused practice enables targeted improvement and builds confidence in specific knowledge areas.

requirements.title: Intelligent Exam Scheduling
requirements.description: The system must calculate and suggest optimal exam dates based on current proficiency, required topics to cover, estimated study time needed, and student-defined target scores. The scheduler should integrate with gap analysis to predict readiness dates.
requirements.rationale: Intelligent scheduling helps students plan their preparation timeline and set realistic exam dates.

requirements.title: Admin Question Management Dashboard
requirements.description: The system must provide an administrative dashboard for managing questions and question banks, supporting: adding/editing/deleting questions, organizing by categories and criteria, bulk import/export, filtering and search, psychometric parameter management, and question status workflow.
requirements.rationale: Efficient question management is essential for maintaining high-quality, organized question banks.

requirements.title: Question Bank Organization
requirements.description: The admin dashboard must support organizing questions into multiple question banks with configurable categories, difficulty levels, topic tags, exam types, and custom criteria. Questions can belong to multiple banks and categories.
requirements.rationale: Flexible question organization enables efficient content reuse across different exam types and domains.

requirements.title: Platform Exam Catalog
requirements.description: The system must provide a browsable catalog of platform-owned exams (GMAT, GRE, NCLEX, etc.) that students can discover, preview, and purchase. The catalog must support filtering by exam type, difficulty, price, and ratings.
requirements.rationale: A well-organized exam catalog is essential for B2C discovery and conversion.

requirements.title: Student Subscription Plans
requirements.description: The system must support recurring subscription plans (Basic, Premium, Unlimited) that grant students access to multiple exams. Subscriptions must be managed via Stripe with automatic renewal, cancellation, and plan upgrade/downgrade capabilities.
requirements.rationale: Subscription revenue provides predictable recurring income and encourages student engagement.

requirements.title: One-Time Exam Purchases
requirements.description: The system must support one-time purchases of individual exams for students who prefer not to subscribe. Purchases grant permanent access to the exam with all features including analytics and progress tracking.
requirements.rationale: One-time purchases offer flexibility for students who only need specific exams.

requirements.title: Mobile App Support
requirements.description: The system must provide native mobile applications for iOS and Android that allow students to browse exams, take tests, and view analytics. The mobile app must support offline exam caching for uninterrupted testing.
requirements.rationale: Mobile apps increase accessibility and allow students to study on-the-go.

requirements.title: Progress Sync Across Devices
requirements.description: The system must synchronize student progress, exam history, and analytics across all devices (web and mobile) in real-time. Students should be able to start an exam on one device and continue on another.
requirements.rationale: Cross-device sync ensures a seamless experience for students who use multiple devices.

glossary.Theta: Ability estimate on the IRT scale
